MaskGenerator

class MaskGenerator[source]

Method class to generate masks for astronomical images.

This class provides methods

  1. Generation of invalid pixel mask with NaN and large connected regions of zero value.

  2. Generation of source mask with SExtractor-like detection.

  3. Generation of circular mask for given position and radius.

  4. Generation of cosmic ray mask with Astroscrappy.

MaskGenerator.__init__def ezphot.methods.MaskGenerator.__init__()

Methods

mask_sources(self, target_img, target_mask=None, sigma=5.0, mask_radius_factor=3, saturation_level=50000, save=False, verbose=True, visualize=True, save_fig=False)

Generate source mask.

Parameters:

  • target_img (ScienceImage or ReferenceImage or CalibrationImage) – The target image to generate the source mask from.

  • target_mask (Mask, optional) – The mask to use for the source mask generation.

  • sigma (float, optional) – The sigma for the source mask generation.

  • mask_radius_factor (float, optional) – The mask radius factor for the source mask generation.

  • saturation_level (float, optional) – The saturation level for the source mask generation.

  • save (bool, optional) – Whether to save the source mask.

  • verbose (bool, optional) – Whether to print verbose output.

  • visualize (bool, optional) – Whether to visualize the source mask.

  • save_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to save the source mask as a figure.

Returns:

target_mask – The source mask.

Return type:

Mask

mask_circle(self, target_img, target_mask=None, mask_type='source', x_position=None, y_position=None, radius_arcsec=None, unit='deg', save=False, verbose=True, visualize=True, save_fig=False)

Add a circular mask to the mask image using photutils CircularAperture.

Parameters:

  • target_img (ScienceImage or ReferenceImage or CalibrationImage) – The target image to generate the circular mask from.

  • target_mask (Mask, optional) – The mask to use for the circular mask generation.

  • mask_type (str, optional) – The type of mask to generate. [‘invalid’, ‘source’, ‘cosmicray’, ‘badpixel’, ‘subtraction’]

  • x_position (float, optional) – The x position of the circular mask.

  • y_position (float, optional) – The y position of the circular mask.

  • radius_arcsec (float, optional) – The radius of the circular mask in arcseconds.

  • unit (str, optional) – The unit of the radius. [‘deg’, ‘pixel’]

  • save (bool, optional) – Whether to save the circular mask.

  • verbose (bool, optional) – Whether to print verbose output.

  • visualize (bool, optional) – Whether to visualize the circular mask.

  • save_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to save the circular mask as a figure.

Returns:

target_mask – The circular mask.

Return type:

Mask

mask_invalidpixel(self, target_img, target_mask=None, threshold_invalid_connection=100000, save=False, verbose=True, visualize=True, save_fig=False)

Generate invalid pixel mask.

Parameters:

  • target_img (ScienceImage or ReferenceImage or CalibrationImage) – The target image to generate the invalid pixel mask from.

  • target_mask (Mask, optional) – The mask to use for the invalid pixel mask generation.

  • threshold_invalid_connection (int, optional) – The threshold for the invalid pixel mask generation.

  • save (bool, optional) – Whether to save the invalid pixel mask.

  • verbose (bool, optional) – Whether to print verbose output.

  • visualize (bool, optional) – Whether to visualize the invalid pixel mask.

  • save_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to save the invalid pixel mask as a figure.

Returns:

target_mask – The invalid pixel mask.

Return type:

Mask

mask_cosmicray(self, target_img, target_mask=None, gain=None, readnoise=None, sigclip=6, sigfrac=0.5, objlim=5.0, niter=4, cleantype='medmask', fsmode='median', psffwhm=None, saturation_level=30000, save=False, verbose=True, visualize=True, save_fig=False)

Generate cosmic ray mask.

Parameters:

  • target_img (ScienceImage or ReferenceImage or CalibrationImage) – The target image to generate the cosmic ray mask from.

  • target_mask (Mask, optional) – The mask to use for the cosmic ray mask generation.

  • gain (float, optional) – The gain of the image.

  • readnoise (float, optional) – The readnoise of the image.

  • sigclip (float, optional) – The sigma clip for the cosmic ray mask generation.

  • sigfrac (float, optional) – The sigma fraction for the cosmic ray mask generation.

  • objlim (float, optional) – The object limit for the cosmic ray mask generation.

  • niter (int, optional) – The number of iterations for the cosmic ray mask generation.

  • cleantype (str, optional) – The clean type for the cosmic ray mask generation.

  • fsmode (str, optional) – The fsmode for the cosmic ray mask generation.

  • psffwhm (float, optional) – The psf fwhm for the cosmic ray mask generation.

  • saturation_level (float, optional) – The saturation level for the cosmic ray mask generation.

  • save (bool, optional) – Whether to save the cosmic ray mask.

  • verbose (bool, optional) – Whether to print verbose output.

  • visualize (bool, optional) – Whether to visualize the cosmic ray mask.

  • save_fig (bool, optional) – Whether to save the cosmic ray mask as a figure.

Returns:

target_mask – The cosmic ray mask.

Return type:

Mask
